parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Soon, quickly, hastily. Adverb from tachus; briefly, i.e. speedily, or rapidly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From meta and tithemi; to transfer, i.e. transport, exchange, change sides, or pervert.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
